descriptions: The response does not state that diminishing marginal returns begin after the third worker and/or does not explain that the marginal product (MP) of the fourth worker (15) was less than the MP of the third worker (20).

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does none of the following:

· States that the wage rate the firm will pay will decrease and explains that a decrease in the price of accounting software will result in a decrease in the demand for workers because accounting software and workers are substitutes in providing accounting services. A decrease in the demand for workers will decrease the market wage and therefore decrease the wage rate paid by the firm because the firm is a wage taker.

· States that the demand curve for bookkeepers by Michelle’s Accounting Company will stay the same in the short run and explains that the firm’s demand curve for labor is the marginal revenue product of labor (MRP), which is the price of the service times the marginal product, and in the short run there is no change in the price of the service or the marginal product.

Or states that the demand curve for bookkeepers by Michelle’s Accounting Company will decrease in the long run and explains that the firm’s demand curve for labor is the marginal revenue product of labor (MRP) which is the price of the service times the marginal product, and a decrease in the price of an input will increase the supply of accounting services in the market, which will decrease the market price of accounting services, and therefore will decrease the marginal revenue product for every unit of labor.
